MISSING ANALYSIS OF 0 < q < 1 REGIME: The node writes '[2j+1]_q ~ q^{2j}/(q-q^{-1})' without specifying that this formula holds only for q > 1. For 0 < q < 1:

[2j+1]_q = (q^{2j+1} - q^{-(2j+1)})/(q - q^{-1}) ~ q^{-(2j+1)}/(q^{-1} - q) ~ q^{-2j}/(q^{-1} - q)

This grows as (1/q)^{2j}, which has exponential rate 2|log q| = -2 log q (since log q < 0 for 0 < q < 1).

Moreover, node 1.3.1 claims Vol_hyp < 0 for 0 < q < 1, giving EXPONENTIAL DECAY of the 6j symbol. If {6j}_q ~ exp(j * Vol_hyp) with Vol_hyp < 0, and [2j+1]_q ~ exp(2j |log q|), then the exponential growth of the normalization can DOMINATE the exponential decay of the 6j symbol. The ratio exp(j * (Vol_hyp - 2|log q|)) would be doubly suppressed, potentially making non-melonic diagrams even MORE suppressed than in the classical case, not less. This completely reverses the node's conclusion for 0 < q < 1.

The node claims melonic dominance breaks down for ALL q != 1, but the 0 < q < 1 case may actually exhibit ENHANCED melonic dominance. This asymmetry between q > 1 and 0 < q < 1 is mathematically significant and is not addressed.
